ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became more familiar and comfortable with writing lab reports. I also learned about lab notebook-keeping etiquette.
Great course about model organisms and basic lab bench techniques

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: good class with interesting topics, but often lab instructions and assignment instructions felt unclear and confusing.

strengths: well run course with a lot of resources. Each week usually had a different model organism.

weaknesses: sometimes expectations weren't always clear, especially with due dates or what we were going to be doing in the lab

Strengths: clarity of expectations, ease of material
Weaknesses: flexibility with deadlines
Great course with really interesting topics. Labs were sometimes quite repetitive

This lab class gives students a fair amount of freedom to design their own experiments, which makes it more engaging. However, it would be better if professor Moreno could provide a clearer rubric for assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you have not had lab experience before this course is great at giving an introduction into biology research. At the end of each lab handout, there are a bunch of labs at Yale that are involved in similar research that week's lab was focused on. I think this is a great resource for those who are looking to join a lab but don't know where to get started.

Yes!!!! I loved this course a lot. I loved my TF and Dr. Moreno's teaching. They are both phenomenal in their work and they truly know so much. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to learn about lab methods. The lab reports are an upwards hill to learn but once you get past it, it's truly so rewarding to learn and write. Come to class prepared and you will do well.
Yes, definitely take this course if you are thinking of doing lab research at some point with model organisms!
